plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are large, bright yellow flowers known for their ability to track the sun's movement. They thrive in temperate climates and are often cultivated for their seeds and oil.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, including North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, turning their flower heads to follow the sun from east to west during the day.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: Black-eyed Susan features vibrant yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. It is a hardy wildflower frequently seen in meadows and prairies.
plants.funFact: This plant is the state flower of Maryland, USA, symbolizing encouragement and motivation.

plants.name: Dahlias
plants.description: Dahlias display a wide variety of colors and flower forms, from small pom-poms to large dinner-plate blooms. They are popular ornamental plants in gardens.
plants.location: Cultivated worldwide, originally from Mexico and Central America
plants.funFact: Dahlias were declared the national flower of Mexico in 1963, reflecting their cultural significance.

plants.name: Hydrangea macrophylla
plants.description: Bigleaf hydrangeas are known for their large, spherical flower clusters that change color based on soil pH, ranging from pink to blue.
plants.location: Native to Japan; widely cultivated in temperate gardens globally
plants.funFact: The color variation in hydrangea flowers is due to aluminum availability in the soil, which is influenced by soil pH.
